Package oracle.kubernetes.operator.work

Class Step

java.lang.Object
oracle.kubernetes.operator.work.Step
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractListStep, AsyncRequestStep, BeforeAdminServiceStep, ClusterServicesStep, ConfigMapAfterStep, DeleteDomainStep, DomainPresenceStep, HttpAsyncRequestStep, HttpResponseStep, ManagedServersUpStep, ManagedServerUpAfterStep, ManagedServerUpIteratorStep, ReadHealthStep, ResponseStep, ServerDownIteratorStep, ServerDownStep, WatchDomainIntrospectorJobReadyStep, WatchPodReadyAdminStep
public abstract class Step
extends java.lang.Object
Individual step in a processing flow.

      Returns:

      public abstract NextAction apply​(Packet packet)
      Invokes step using the packet as input/output context. The next action directs further processing of the Fiber.

      packet - Packet
      Returns:

    • doDelay

      protected NextAction doDelay​(Step step, Packet packet, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      Create NextAction that indicates the the current fiber resume with the indicated step after a delay.
      Parameters:
      step - Step from which to resume
      packet - Packet to provide when retrying this step
      delay - Delay time
      unit - Delay time unit
      Returns:
      The next action

    • doSuspend

      protected NextAction doSuspend​(java.util.function.Consumer<AsyncFiber> onExit)
      Create NextAction that suspends the current Fiber. While suspended the Fiber does not consume a thread. Resume the Fiber using Fiber.resume(Packet)
      Parameters:
      onExit - Called after fiber is suspended
      Returns:
      Next action

    • doSuspend

      protected NextAction doSuspend​(Step step, java.util.function.Consumer<AsyncFiber> onExit)
      Create NextAction that suspends the current Fiber. While suspended the Fiber does not consume a thread. When the Fiber resumes it will start with the indicated step. Resume the Fiber using Fiber.resume(Packet)
      Parameters:
      step - Step to invoke next when resumed
      onExit - Called after fiber is suspended
      Returns:
      Next action

    • getNext

      public Step getNext()

    • doForkJoin

      protected NextAction doForkJoin​(Step step, Packet packet, java.util.Collection<Step.StepAndPacket> startDetails)
      Create a NextAction that suspends the current Fiber and that starts child fibers for each step and packet pair. When all of the created child fibers complete, then this fiber is resumed with the indicated step and packet.
      Parameters:
      step - Step to invoke next when resumed after child fibers complete
      packet - Resume packet
      startDetails - Pairs of step and packet to use when starting child fibers
      Returns:
      Next action

    • doForkAtLeastOne

      protected NextAction doForkAtLeastOne​(Step step, Packet packet, java.util.Collection<Step.StepAndPacket> startDetails)
      Create a NextAction that suspends the current Fiber and that starts child fibers for each step and packet pair. When at least one of the created child fibers completes, then this fiber is resumed with the indicated step and packet and any other child fibers are cancelled.
      Parameters:
      step - Step to invoke next when resumed after at least one child fiber completes
      packet - Resume packet
      startDetails - Pairs of step and packet to use when starting child fibers
      Returns:
      Next action
